story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_elevation
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Elevation. Cohutta Gravel Grinder is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Cohutta Gravel Grinder? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Cohutta Gravel Grinder scored 61 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Cohutta Gravel Grinder?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Cohutta Gravel Grinder. Chatsworth, Georgia. 100 mi. Mountain gravel for 100 miles.
beats.text_on_screen: Cohutta Gravel Grinder | Chatsworth, Georgia | 100 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Elevation gain that belongs on a trail run. The Big Frog climb at 60 miles and the "massive climb on FS 62" define the course's punishment. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. Experience. 4 out of 5. Genuinely unique. Hard to replicate. Carla Williams captured the suffer-fest reality: "The last twenty miles were a straight out suffer fest. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Technical enough to thin the pack. Leia Schneeberger discovered the course composition misconception: "I had been informed the race was mostly single track in style with a 'portion' of gravel. Prestige. 3 out of 5. Respected. Not yet legendary. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Solid production value. Six aid stations support the 100-mile course with bag drops and cooling stations during hot years.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: The case for Cohutta Gravel Grinder.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Chattanooga 45 minutes or Atlanta 1.5 hours
Lodging: Chatsworth has limited lodging. Dalton or Chattanooga have more options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: North Georgia Mountain Century Challenge. If you want a 100-mile mountain challenge with significant climbing. yes, it's a solid event. If you want pro field depth or cooler conditions. look elsewhere.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Cohutta Gravel Grinder isn't quite right for you. For better mountain events: Leadville, Crusher. For similar regional events: other Georgia gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Cohutta Gravel Grinder? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic pose, 'Cohutta Gravel Grinder' bold text, tier badge 'ELITE', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
